executive_summary.product_overview: TeachTrack CBC is a comprehensive curriculum tracking and notes management system designed for Kenyan CBC teachers in Grades 1-10. The platform enables teachers to upload and digitize curriculum PDFs, track teaching progress, organize and present notes, and generate progress reports.
problem_statement: Manual tracking across multiple subjects with complex strand structures.
Teaching materials scattered across books, Word docs, PDFs, and PowerPoints.
Time wasted searching for notes and remembering lesson positions.
No visibility into progress or schedule.
solution: AI-powered PDF parsing and visual progress tracking.
Centralized notes library with one-click presentation mode.

documentation.overview: TeachTrack CBC is a digital assistant for Kenyan teachers teaching the Competency-Based Curriculum (CBC) from Grade 1 to Grade 10. It acts as a 'Google Maps for your curriculum' and 'Dropbox for your teaching notes.'

core_problems.problem: Where Am I in the Curriculum?
before: Teacher manually tracks curriculum position in a PDF.
after: Dashboard shows subject progress and current lesson.
One-click to mark lesson complete and auto-advance.

before: Notes scattered across devices and platforms.
after: All notes organized by subject, strand, and sub-strand.
Instant search and fullscreen presentation mode.

step_by_step: Teacher signs up and verifies email.
Adds first subject by uploading a curriculum PDF or choosing from pre-loaded library.
System parses PDF using AI, extracts strands, sub-strands, lessons, and learning outcomes.
Teacher reviews and confirms parsed curriculum.
Dashboard displays all subjects with progress bars and quick actions.
Teacher marks lessons complete, uploads and organizes notes, and presents notes in class.
Offline support allows marking lessons and accessing notes without internet.
Progress reports can be generated and exported for headteachers.

ai_parsing.challenge: Curriculum PDFs have complex, inconsistent structures (tables, bullets, etc.)
solution: Send to Qwen AI for structure extraction (strands, sub-strands, lessons, outcomes, questions)
Return as JSON, validate, and calculate confidence score.
Fallback to regex parsing if AI fails.
Teacher reviews and confirms before saving.

sub_strands.name: Controlling Soil Pollution
learning_outcomes: Control soil pollution in home environment
sub_strands.key_inquiry: How can household practices cause soil pollution?

documentation.data_flow: Frontend (Next.js) uploads PDF → Backend (FastAPI) extracts text and sends to Qwen AI via OpenRouter API → AI returns parsed JSON → Backend validates and saves to database → Frontend displays parsed curriculum for review.

mobile_experience.home_screen: App icon, tap to open, native-like experience.
mobile_experience.dashboard: Shows all subjects, progress bars, and quick actions.
mobile_experience.offline_mode: Banner indicates offline, cached data accessible, syncs when online.

teacher_journey: Monday: Opens app, checks today's lesson, downloads notes for offline use.
Teaches lesson, presents notes, marks lesson complete.
Tuesday: Uploads new worksheets, tags and organizes them.
Friday: Reviews weekly progress and reports.
Sunday: Prepares for next week, downloads needed notes.
value_proposition: Saves time by organizing notes and automating progress tracking.
Provides peace of mind with clear curriculum position and visual progress.
Accessible anywhere, works offline, no expensive hardware needed.
Freemium model: free for 2 subjects, affordable premium tier.

aha_moment.before: Uncertainty about curriculum position, scattered notes, wasted time.
aha_moment.after: Open app, see exact lesson, present notes, mark complete in seconds.
